intro: Pityrodia spectabilis, commonly known as the showy pityrodia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
